headline: GOP women's PAC endorses Amanda Adkins, Lisa Scheller to take on Democrat House incumbents in midterms
author: Tyler Olson
sentences:
(Rachel Mummey/Bloomberg via Getty Images)

The endorsements from WFW are significant due to the group's role in helping House Republicans significantly outperform expectations in the 2020 elections, even as former President Trump lost.

FIRST ON FOX: The Republican PAC Winning for Women is endorsing House candidates Amanda Adkins in Kansas and Lisa Scheller in Pennsylvania Wednesday, marking the group's third round of endorsements in the 2022 cycle.

"Amanda and Lisa are no exception, and thanks to their experiences, are in strong positions to flip their seats red and help Republicans take back the House," Perez-Cubas added.
It was one of the early backers of Rep. Maria Salazar, R-Fla., who unseated Rep. Donna Shalala, D-Fla., in the Miami-area district that voted for President Biden over Trump.
Its second round supported candidates Esther Joy King, Monica De La Cruz-Hernandez and Jen Kiggans, all of whom are trying again to flip blue seats to red.
Adkins is running in Kansas' 3rd Congressional District, which is generally a swing district and is currently represented by Rep. Sharice Davids, D-Kan.
WFW announced its first round of endorsements of the 2022 cycle in June – all freshman Republican women who face tough 2022 reelection challenges.

Scheller is running in Pennsylvania's 7th Congressional District, which Rep. Susan Wild, D-Pa., currently represents.
She's endorsed by Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, and former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, a Kansas native himself.
According to FiveThirtyEight, WFW-backed candidates have an 87% winning percentage in primary races.
